I just closed on my 500th home this year.

Not bragging‚Äîjust context for what I'm about to share.

The buyers who have the BEST experience all do one thing differently.

It's not about having the biggest budget.
It's not about knowing construction terminology.
It's not even about getting the best deal.

It's this: They ask to see the home BEFORE the drywall goes up.

Here's why that matters:

üîç WHAT YOU CAN'T SEE (After Drywall):
‚Ä¢ Foundation waterproofing quality
‚Ä¢ Insulation installation (gaps = energy waste)
‚Ä¢ Electrical and plumbing routing
‚Ä¢ Framing lumber quality
‚Ä¢ HVAC ductwork installation
‚Ä¢ Structural elements and load-bearing details

Once the walls are closed up, you're trusting the builder did it right.

Every buyer gets a pre-drywall walkthrough with our construction manager. You see everything. You ask anything. We explain it all.
